admin.adminGuardForbiddenTitle: Admin access required for these controls
admin.adminGuardNotFoundTitle: Admin APIs are not available on this server
admin.adminGuardForbiddenBody: Sign in as an admin user on your tldw server to view and manage users, roles, and system statistics.
admin.adminGuardNotFoundBody: This tldw server does not expose the /admin endpoints, or they are disabled. Upgrade or reconfigure the server to enable these views.
admin.adminGuardLearnMore: Learn more in the tldw server documentation.
admin.adminGuardLimitedInfo: Admin-level details and controls are hidden until admin APIs are available.
admin.adminGuardConnectionHint: Only basic connection details are shown; admin dashboards are disabled until admin APIs are available.

promptStudio.title: Prompt Studio
promptStudio.subtitle: Configure defaults and monitor Prompt Studio health. Connection and auth reuse the main server settings.
promptStudio.defaultsHint: Store default project, model configs, and list page size.
promptStudio.defaultsPlaceholder: Persist defaults using existing settings storage (TBD) for initial project selection, execute/evaluation model presets, and pagination.
promptStudio.unavailable: Prompt Studio isn’t available on the server yet.
promptStudio.unavailableBody: Once enabled, you can monitor queue health and set defaults here.

chatSettings.title: Chat settings
chatSettings.description: Control default behavior for the chat playground and composer.

copilotResumeLastChat.label: Resume the last chat when opening the Sidebar (Copilot)

turnOnChatWithWebsite.label: Enable Chat with Website by default (Copilot)

webUIResumeLastChat.label: Resume the last chat when opening the Web UI

hideCurrentChatModelSettings.label: Hide the current Chat Model Settings

restoreLastChatModel.label: Restore last used model for previous chats

sendNotificationAfterIndexing.label: Send Notification After Finishing Processing the Knowledge Base

ollamaStatus.label: Enable or disable server connection status check

userChatBubble.label: Use Chat Bubble for User Messages

useMarkdownForUserMessage.label: Enable Markdown formatting for User messages

sidepanelTemporaryChat.label: Enable Temporary Chat in Sidebar by default

removeReasoningTagFromCopy.label: Remove Reasoning Tag from Copied Text

promptSearchIncludeServer.label: Include server prompts in prompt search

webuiBtnSidePanel.label: Show Web UI button in Sidebar

deleteChatHistory.label: System Reset
deleteChatHistory.confirm: Are you sure you want to perform a system reset? This will clear all data and cannot be undone.

export.label: Export Chat History, Knowledge Base, and Prompts

import.label: Import Chat History, Knowledge Base, and Prompts

maxWebsiteContext.label: Maximum Content Size for Full Context Mode

visitSpecificWebsite.label: Visit the website mentioned in the message

ttsAutoPlay.label: Auto play voice response after completion

stt.heading: Speech-to-Text Settings
stt.usedByChat: These Speech-to-Text defaults are used by the chat dictation button in the Playground and Sidebar.

empty.connectTitle: Connect tldw Assistant to your server
empty.connectDescription: Some settings only take effect when your tldw server is reachable. Connect your server to get the full experience.
empty.connectExample1: Open Settings → tldw server to add your server URL and API key.
empty.connectExample2: Use Diagnostics to confirm your server is healthy before trying advanced tools.
empty.title: Tune how tldw Assistant behaves
empty.description: Adjust defaults for the Web UI, sidepanel, speech, search, and data handling from one place.
empty.example1: Choose your default language, theme, and chat resume behavior.
empty.example2: Control whether chats are temporary, how large pastes are handled, and how reasoning is displayed.

confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this model?
confirm.repull: Are you sure you want to re-pull this model?

notification.pullModelDescription: Pulling {{modelName}} model. For more details, check the extension icon.
notification.someError: Something went wrong. Please try again later

managePrompts.title: Manage Prompts
managePrompts.workspaceDescription: Reusable prompts are managed from the Prompts workspace. Use the button below to open it.

segmented.helpCustom: Create and manage reusable prompts you can insert into chat.
segmented.helpCopilot: View and tweak predefined Copilot prompts provided by your server.

confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this prompt? This action cannot be undone.

prompt.label: Prompt
prompt.help: You can use {key} as variable in your prompt.
prompt.missingTextPlaceholder: The {text} variable is missing in the prompt. Please add it.

notification.someError: Something went wrong. Please try again later

managePrompts.loadErrorHelp: Check your server connection and refresh to try again.
managePrompts.emptyConnectDescription: To manage reusable prompts, first connect to your tldw server.
managePrompts.emptyConnectExample1: Open Settings → tldw server to add your server URL.
managePrompts.emptyConnectExample2: Once connected, create custom prompts you can reuse across chats.
managePrompts.emptyDescription: Create reusable prompts for recurring tasks, workflows, and team conventions.
managePrompts.emptyExample1: Save your favorite system prompt for summaries, explanations, or translations.
managePrompts.emptyExample2: Create quick prompts for common actions like drafting emails or refining notes.
managePrompts.filterHelp: Search matches title and prompt content. Use type and tags to narrow the list.
managePrompts.copilotEmptyDescription: Copilot prompts are predefined templates provided by your tldw server.
managePrompts.copilotEmptyExample1: Check your server version or configuration if you expect Copilot prompts to be available.
managePrompts.copilotEmptyExample2: After updating your server, reload the extension and return to this tab.

url.label: Page Share URL
url.required: Please input your Page Share URL!
url.help: For privacy reasons, you can self-host the page share and provide the URL here. <anchor>Learn More</anchor>.

webshare.heading: Web Share

confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this share? This action cannot be undone.

webshare.label: Manage Page Share
webshare.description: Enable or disable the page share feature

notification.someError: Something went wrong. Please try again later

globalEnable.label: Enable or Disable Server Integration Globally
globalEnable.warning: By disabling the server integration globally, tldw Browser_Assistant won't fetch models from the server. You can still add providers from the <anchor>OpenAI compatible API</anchor> section if needed.

advanced.label: Advanced Server URL Configuration

urlRewriteEnabled.label: Enable or Disable Custom Origin URL

autoCORSFix.label: Enable or Disable Automatic CORS Fix

advanced.help: If you have connection issues with the server, you can configure a custom origin URL. To learn more about the configuration, <anchor>click here</anchor>.

about.title: About
about.heading: About
about.support: You can support the tldw Browser_Assistant project by donating or sponsoring through the following platforms:

manageKnowledge.title: Knowledge QA
manageKnowledge.heading: Knowledge QA
manageKnowledge.worldBooksSettingsDescription: World Books are managed from the World Books workspace. Use the button below to open it.
manageKnowledge.dictionariesSettingsDescription: Chat dictionaries are managed from the Chat dictionaries workspace. Use the button below to open it.

charactersSettingsDescription: Characters are managed from the Characters workspace. Use the button below to open it.

manageCharacters.title: Manage Characters

tags.label: Tags
tags.help: Use tags to group characters by use case (e.g., “writing”, “teaching”).

confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this character? This action cannot be undone.

conversations.title: Conversations for {{name}}
conversations.subtitle: Select a conversation to continue as this character.
conversations.empty: No conversations found for this character yet.
conversations.error: Unable to load conversations for this character.

form.description: Define a reusable character you can chat with in the sidebar.

systemPrompt.label: Behavior / instructions
systemPrompt.placeholder: E.g., You are a patient math teacher who explains concepts step by step and checks understanding with short examples.
systemPrompt.help: Explain the character's role, tone, and constraints. For example: "You are a patient math tutor who explains concepts step by step."
systemPrompt.min: Add a short description so the character knows how to respond.

greeting.label: Greeting message (optional)
greeting.placeholder: Hi there! I’m your writing coach. Paste your draft and I’ll help you tighten it up.
greeting.help: Optional first message the character will send when you start a chat.

notification.someError: Something went wrong. Please try again later

loadError.title: Couldn't load characters
loadError.description: Check your connection and try again.

manageCharacters.emptyDescription: Create a reusable character with a name, description, and system prompt you can chat with.
manageCharacters.emptyExample1: Define a writing coach, lore expert, or coding assistant you can reuse across chats.
manageCharacters.emptyExample2: Give each character a clear description and behavior so their responses stay consistent.

model.label: Embedding Model
model.help: Highly recommended to use embedding models like `nomic-embed-text`.
model.helpMissing: Previously saved embedding model is no longer available on the server. Please choose another model.

totalFilePerKB.label: Knowledge Base Default File Upload Limit
totalFilePerKB.required: Please enter the default file upload limit

noOfRetrievedDocs.label: Number of Retrieved Documents
noOfRetrievedDocs.required: Please enter the number of retrieved documents

prompt.label: Configure RAG Prompt
prompt.alert: Configuring the system prompt here is deprecated. Please use the Manage Prompts section to add or edit prompts. This section will be removed in a future release
prompt.webSearchPromptHelp: Do not remove `{search_results}` from the prompt.
prompt.webSearchPromptError: Please enter a web search prompt
prompt.webSearchFollowUpPromptHelp: Do not remove `{chat_history}` and `{question}` from the prompt.
prompt.webSearchFollowUpPromptError: Please input your Web Search Follow Up Prompt!
prompt.webSearchFollowUpPromptPlaceholder: Your Web Search Follow Up Prompt

healthPage.title: Health Status
healthPage.subtitle: Quick overview of how your tldw server powers chat, Knowledge search, media ingest, and other tools.
healthPage.noServerBannerBody: You can explore the UI first, then connect a tldw server later to enable chat history, media ingest, and Knowledge search.
healthPage.copyDiagnosticsHelp: Copies JSON diagnostics (server URL, status codes, and anonymized environment info) to your clipboard. API keys and message content are not included.
healthPage.unableToReachCore: Unable to reach server core health endpoint.
healthPage.configureHint: Please configure a server URL under tldw settings.
healthPage.intervalWarning: Short intervals can put load on your server. Consider using at least {{seconds}}s.

checks.coreDescription: Verifies the main chat API. If this is unhealthy, confirm your server URL, API key, and core logs.
checks.ragDescription: Powers Knowledge search & retrieval. If this is unhealthy, ensure RAG is enabled and the knowledge index has been built on your server.
checks.audioDescription: Covers text-to-speech and speech-to-text APIs. If this is unhealthy, confirm your audio endpoints are enabled and reachable.
checks.embeddingsDescription: Checks the embeddings and indexing services used for retrieval. If this is unhealthy, rebuild your embedding index or restart the worker.
checks.metricsDescription: Verifies metrics and monitoring endpoints. If this is unhealthy, metrics dashboards or alerting may be unavailable.
checks.chatMetricsDescription: Tracks chat analytics such as volume and latency. If this is unhealthy, chat metrics collection or endpoints may be failing.
checks.mcpDescription: Checks Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools. If this is unhealthy, external tools and plugins may not be available in chat.

healthSummary.diagnosticsTooltip: Open detailed diagnostics to troubleshoot or inspect health checks.
healthSummary.footerInfo: These checks summarize the last successful ping to your tldw server and knowledge index.

storage.quotaFriendlyMessage: Too many settings writes in a short period; please wait a few seconds and try again.
storage.writeErrorDescription: We couldn't save your settings. Please try again shortly.

onboarding.title: Welcome — Let’s get you connected
onboarding.description: Connect this extension to your tldw server (a separate app running on your machine or server). We’ll walk through adding the URL, API key, and checking that everything is reachable.
onboarding.exploreWithoutServer: You can explore the UI without a server; some features (chat, media ingest, Knowledge search) will stay disabled until you connect.

serverUrl.label: Server URL
serverUrl.emptyHint: Enter your tldw server URL to enable Next.
serverUrl.invalid: Enter a full URL such as http://127.0.0.1:8000.
serverUrl.invalidProtocol: Use http or https URLs, for example http://127.0.0.1:8000.
serverUrl.ready: We’ll enable Next once we can reach this address.
serverUrl.reachable: Server responded successfully. You can continue.
serverUrl.unreachable: We couldn’t reach this address yet. Double-check the URL or try again.

apiKey.label: API Key
apiKey.placeholder: Enter your API key (or use the default demo key THIS-IS-A-SECURE-KEY-123-REPLACE-ME for local single-user setups)

connection.label: Connection:
connection.continueAnyway: You can finish setup now and explore the UI without a server. Chat, media ingest, and Knowledge search will remain limited until you connect a tldw server from Settings → tldw Server.

rag.label: Knowledge search & retrieval:
rag.help: Checks whether your server can search your notes, media, and other connected knowledge sources.

path.heading: How would you like to get started?
path.noServer: I don’t have a server yet
path.demo: Just explore with a local demo
path.noServerTitle: No server yet? You can still explore.
path.noServerBody: tldw_server is a separate, self-hosted app. You can follow the setup guide now, or come back later and continue in demo mode.
path.noServerOptionLocal: Run locally with Docker or Python on your own machine.
path.noServerOptionRemote: Deploy tldw_server to a remote VPS or managed hosting.
path.noServerOptionManaged: Use a managed commercial tldw_server deployment when available.
path.demoTitle: Explore the extension in demo mode
path.demoBody: Demo mode lets you try chat, notes, and media with sample data. Server-dependent features like Knowledge search will stay limited until you connect your own tldw_server.

onboarding.authModeHelp: Single User (API Key) is recommended for personal or small-team servers. Multi User (Login) is for shared deployments where people sign in with usernames or SSO. Choose the mode that matches how your tldw_server is set up.

auth.missingCredentials: Enter both a username and password to continue.

onboarding.apiKeyHelp: Find your API key in tldw_server → Settings → API Keys. Generate a key there and paste it here.
onboarding.authStepAria: Step 3 of 4 — Choose how you sign in
onboarding.confirmStepAria: Step 4 of 4 — Confirm connection and review next steps

nextSteps.title: You’re ready to go
nextSteps.subtitle: From here you can open the sidepanel, ingest a page, or explore media and notes.
nextSteps.chatBody: Open the sidepanel and ask your first question.
nextSteps.ingestBody: Use Quick ingest from the header to save the current tab to your server.
nextSteps.mediaBody: Visit Media and Notes in Options to see what’s stored and searchable.

onboarding.headerShortcuts: Show quick shortcuts in the header
onboarding.footerHelp: Once connected, you can revisit these settings anytime from the extension menu.

errors.invalidCredentials: Login failed. Check your username and password or confirm multi-user login is enabled on your tldw server.
errors.forbidden: Forbidden. Check that your user account has permission to log in.
errors.serverUnreachable: Couldn’t reach your tldw server. Check the server URL or open Health & diagnostics for more details.
errors.generic: Login failed. Open Health & diagnostics from the header to inspect server errors.

tldw.loadError: Unable to load tldw server settings. Check your connection and try again.

apiKey.label: API Key
apiKey.placeholder: Enter your API key (default demo key: THIS-IS-A-SECURE-KEY-123-REPLACE-ME for local single-user setups)
apiKey.extra: Your tldw_server API key for authentication. For local single-user demos, you can use the default key THIS-IS-A-SECURE-KEY-123-REPLACE-ME unless you have changed it on the server.

serverUrl.label: Server URL
serverUrl.extra: The URL of your tldw_server instance (e.g., http://localhost:8000)

errors.serverUnreachableDetailed: Server not reachable. Check that your tldw_server is running and that your browser can reach it, then try again. Health & diagnostics can help debug connectivity issues.
errors.connectionFailedDetailed: Connection failed. Please check your server URL and API key, then open Health & diagnostics for more details.
errors.seeHealth: Open Health & diagnostics for more details.

about.title: About tldw server integration
about.description: tldw server turns this extension into a full workspace for chat, Knowledge search, and media.

tldw.timeoutPresetHint: Balanced works well for most setups. Extended adds extra headroom for slower networks or long-running jobs.

loginRequired.title: Login Required
loginRequired.description: Please login with your tldw_server credentials

loggedIn.title: Logged In
loggedIn.description: You are currently logged in to tldw_server

connection.success: Server responded successfully. You can continue.
connection.failed: Connection failed. Please check your settings.

hints.requestTimeout: Abort initial requests if no response within this time. Default: {{seconds}}s.
hints.streamingIdle: Abort streaming if no updates received within this time. Default: {{seconds}}s.

login.invalidCredentials: Login failed. Check your username/password or confirm multi-user auth is enabled on your tldw server.
login.forbidden: Forbidden. Check that this user has permission to log in.
login.serverUnreachable: Couldn’t reach your tldw server. Check the server URL or open Health & diagnostics for more details.
login.generic: Login failed. See Health & diagnostics for server details.

evaluations.title: Evaluations playground
evaluations.subtitle: Define evaluations against your tldw server and inspect recent runs.
evaluations.loadErrorDescription: Check your tldw server connection and API credentials, then try again.
evaluations.emptyList: No evaluations yet. Once you create one, it will appear here.
evaluations.rateLimitsErrorDescription: We could not retrieve evaluation quotas from the server.
evaluations.rateLimitsNoData: Rate limit information is not available for this server.
evaluations.noEvalSelectedRuns: Select an evaluation to see its recent runs.
evaluations.runsEmpty: No runs yet for this evaluation.
evaluations.noRunSelected: Select a run to see details.
evaluations.datasetsEmpty: No datasets yet. Create one to attach to evaluations.
evaluations.datasetCreateSuccessDescription: Your dataset is ready to use in evaluations.
evaluations.datasetCreateErrorDescription: The server rejected this dataset. Check the fields and try again.
evaluations.evalNameValidation: Use only letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores.
evaluations.evalSpecParseError: Evaluation spec must be valid JSON.
evaluations.inlineDatasetCheckbox: Attach inline dataset instead of referencing dataset_id
evaluations.createErrorDescription: The server rejected this evaluation. Ensure name, type, and spec are valid.
evaluations.deleteConfirmDescription: This will remove the evaluation definition. Runs already created remain in history.
evaluations.noEvalSelectedDetails: Select an evaluation to inspect its spec.
evaluations.runCreateSuccessDescription: Your evaluation run has started. You can monitor it from the server UI.
evaluations.runCreateErrorDescription: The server rejected this run request. Check the model and try again.
evaluations.historyEmpty: Run a query to see recent activity.
evaluations.emptyConnectDescription: To create and run evaluations, first connect to your tldw server.
evaluations.emptyConnectExample1: Open Settings → tldw server to add your server URL and API key.
evaluations.emptyConnectExample2: Once connected, you can define evaluations and inspect metrics here.
evaluations.datasetSamplesEmpty: No samples returned for this page.

evaluationsSettings.title: Evaluations
evaluationsSettings.subtitle: Configure defaults used by the Evaluations playground.
evaluationsSettings.offline: Connect to your tldw server to test Evaluations.

systemNotifications.syncSuccess: Firefox data synced successfully, You don't need to do this again
systemNotifications.invalidImage: Please select a valid image file

prompts.privateModeDescription: Firefox Private Mode does not support saving data to IndexedDB. Please add prompts from a normal window.

models.privateModeDescription: Firefox Private Mode does not support saving data to IndexedDB. Please add custom model from a normal window.
